Detailed Description

Enhanced wxListCtrl provided custom-drawing among other things.

This class provides these features which the original wxListCtrl lacks:

  • Automatic sort arrows upon clicks on the column headers
  • Custom drawing of items.
  • Hiding of columns through auto-generated popup-menu.
  • Helper function for inserting items pre-sorted.
  • Loading and saving of column properties.
  • Selection of items by typing an initial part of the text (TTS).

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum CMuleListCtrl::MLOrder

The various ways in which a column can be sorted.

If SORT_DES is not set, sorting is taken to be ascending. If SORT_ALT is not set, sorting is taken to be normal.

Enumerator:
SORT_DES 

If set, sorting is to be in descending order.

SORT_ALT 

If sorting should use alternate method.

Is specified in with or without DEC.

bool CMuleListCtrl::AltSortAllowed ( unsigned  column  )  const [protected, virtual]

Must be overwritten to enable alternate sorting.

Parameters:
The column being sorted.

Subclasses of CMuleListCtrl can allow alternative sorting of columns. This is done by overriding this function and returning true for the columns where alternative sorting is desired.

Reimplemented in CSearchListCtrl, and CSharedFilesCtrl.

Check and fix selection state.

Parameters:
event The event which triggered the selection.
Returns:
The index of the item selected or -1 if none.

This function checks if the clicked item is selected. If not, then the item is selected and all other items are deselected.

long CMuleListCtrl::GetInsertPos ( wxUIntPtr  data  ) 

This function tries to locate the best place to insert an item.

Parameters:
The userdata of the new item.

This function does a binary type search to locate the best place to insert the new item with the specified userdata. It then returns the item after this position. To do this, the sorter-function must be set through the SetSortFunc function, otherwise it will just return the position after the last item.

References CompareItems(), and m_sort_func.

Referenced by CSearchListCtrl::AddResult(), CSharedFilesCtrl::DoShowFile(), and CServerListCtrl::RefreshServer().

wxString CMuleListCtrl::GetOldColumnOrder (  )  const [protected, virtual]

Return old column order.

Returns:
The pre-2.2.2 column order.

This function should be overridden in descendant classes to return a comma-separated list of the old column order, when column data was saved/loaded by index. The default implementation returns an empty string, meaning that old settings (if any) should be discarded.

Note:
When you add or remove columns from the list control, DO NOT change this list. This list may only be updated if you changed a column name that is already in this list, to reflect the name change. List order also must be preserved.

Reimplemented in CDownloadListCtrl, CSearchListCtrl, CServerListCtrl, and CSharedFilesCtrl.

Referenced by GetNewColumnIndex().

CMuleListCtrl::ItemDataList CMuleListCtrl::GetSelectedItems (  )  const

Returns a list the user-data of all selected items.

Returns:
A list of data associated with the selected items.

This function will return the user-data for each selected item in a vector, which can then be manipulated with regards to changes made in the current order of the listctrl items.

Referenced by CServerListCtrl::OnPriorityChange(), CServerListCtrl::OnStaticChange(), and SortList().

wxString CMuleListCtrl::GetTTSText ( unsigned  item  )  const [protected, virtual]

Returns the string used when selecting rows via Type-To-Select.

Parameters:
item The index of the item being examined.

By default, this function simply returns the text in the first column for the given item. However, when owner-drawing is enabled, this function _must_ be overriden.

Reimplemented in CDownloadListCtrl, CGenericClientListCtrl, CSearchListCtrl, and CSharedFilesCtrl.

Referenced by OnChar().

long CMuleListCtrl::InsertColumn ( long  col,
const wxString &  heading,
int  format = wxLIST_FORMAT_LEFT,
int  width = -1,
const wxString &  name = wxEmptyString 
)

Insert a new column.

Parameters:
[in] col Column will be inserted at this position.
[in] heading Heading text for the column.
[in] format Format (alignment) of the column.
[in] width The column width.
[in] name Internal name of the column.

We override this method to allow a name to be specified for each column. The name is used for saving/loading column settings independently of their index. It is necessary to set a unique name for each column, to let column settings be saved/loaded. If you don't set a name for a column, settings for that column won't be saved.

Requirements about column names:

  • they must not contain the ':' (colon) and ',' (comma) characters,
  • they should be at least one character long.
Note:
Changing the internal name of one column results in width of that column being reset to default, and if sorting was done by that column, sorting being forgotten. If you change the name of a column, don't forget to update the list GetOldColumnOrder() returns, if necessary.

For more information refer to the wxWidgets documentation of wxListCtrl::InsertColumn()

References m_column_names.

Referenced by CSearchListCtrl::CSearchListCtrl(), CServerListCtrl::CServerListCtrl(), CSharedFilesCtrl::CSharedFilesCtrl(), and CGenericClientListCtrl::InitColumnData().

void CMuleListCtrl::LoadSettings (  )  [virtual]

Loads column settings.

Currently loads the width of all columns, hidden columns, the column to sort by and in which direction to sort. This function also ensures that the items are sorted after the settings have been read.

References GetColumnIndex(), m_column_sizes, m_name, m_sort_func, m_sort_orders, ParseOldConfigEntries(), SetSorting(), SORT_ALT, SORT_DES, and SortList().

Referenced by CSearchListCtrl::CSearchListCtrl(), CServerListCtrl::CServerListCtrl(), CSharedFilesCtrl::CSharedFilesCtrl(), and CGenericClientListCtrl::InitColumnData().

void CMuleListCtrl::SetTableName ( const wxString &  name  )  [inline, protected]

Sets the internally used table-name.

Parameters:
name The new name or an empty string to disable.

You need to call this function with a unique name before you can make use of the LoadSettings/SaveSettings functions. CMuleListCtrl uses the name specified in this command to create unique keynames.

References m_name.

Referenced by CSearchListCtrl::CSearchListCtrl(), CServerListCtrl::CServerListCtrl(), CSharedFilesCtrl::CSharedFilesCtrl(), and CSearchListCtrl::~CSearchListCtrl().

void CMuleListCtrl::SortList (  )  [virtual]

Sorts the list.

Before you can use this function, you will need to specify a sorter function using SetSortFunc. wxListCtrl needs such a function to perform the sort.

References GetSelectedItems(), IsSorting(), m_sort_func, m_sort_orders, ResetTTS(), and SortProc().

Referenced by CDownloadListCtrl::AddFile(), LoadSettings(), CTransferWnd::OnSetDefaultCat(), CServerListCtrl::RefreshServer(), SetSorting(), CSharedFilesCtrl::ShowFileList(), CGenericClientListCtrl::ShowSources(), and CSearchListCtrl::UpdateResult().

int CMuleListCtrl::SortProc ( wxUIntPtr  item1,
wxUIntPtr  item2,
long  sortData 
) [static, private]

Wrapper around the user-provided sorter function.

This function ensures that items are sorted in the order specified by clicking on column-headers, and also enforces that different entries are never considered equal. This is required for lists that make use of child-items, since otherwise, parents may not end up properly located in relation to child-items.

Reimplemented in CDownloadListCtrl, CFileDetailListCtrl, CGenericClientListCtrl, CSearchListCtrl, CServerListCtrl, and CSharedFilesCtrl.

Referenced by SortList().
